intro: Hirtella nitida, commonly known as the velvetleaf hirtella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds. Hirtella nitida is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
